verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Tho' the angry surges roll On my tempest-driven soul, I am peaceful, for I know, Wildly though the winds may blow, I’ve an anchor safe and sure, That can evermore endure.

verse.name: c
v2
verse.lines: Mighty tides about me sweep, Perils lurk within the deep, Angry clouds o’ershade the sky, And the tempest rises high; Still I stand the tempest’s shock, For my anchor grips the Rock.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: I can feel the anchor fast As I meet each sudden blast, And the cable, though unseen, Bears the heavy strain between; Thro' the storm I safely ride, Till the turning of the tide.

verse.name: v4
